intro: Auerodendron cubense var. maisiana, commonly known as the Cuban velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or disturbed habitats, often near water bodies. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, velvety hairs, giving it its common name. The species is known for its rapid growth and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
